item.description: Choose which level of menu/setting's to display. 'Expert'-level shows all items.
Setup how to control the channel changing.
If Teletext caching is enabled, displaying pages will be much faster.
12V output
Choose the order in which the tuner types will be used (for watching and recording).
Choose which tuner will be used first. If set to 'auto' the system will give priority to the tuner having the lowest number of channels/satellites.
When tuned to a service the system will normally scan the transponder for any changes and save them. Only set to 'yes' if you're absolutely sure what you're doing.
Add more details to the crash log
EIT data will be included in http streams.
AIT data will be included in http streams
ECM data will be included in the stream. This enables a client receiver to decode it.
Enables a feature so that the receiver can decrypt streams (if the ECM data is included in the stream and a valid card is available).
Show spinning logo when system is busy.
Choose whether or not to show an icon when a motorized dish is moving.
Services may be grouped in bouquets. If this option is enabled, you can use more then one bouquet.
Enable bouquet selection in Multi-EPG
With this option enabled, Channel numbers will start with '1' in each bouquet.
Services may be grouped in bouquets. If this option is enabled you can zap to a channel in another bouquet then you are in at present.
Use the alternative or the conventional radio mode.
Setup what a long press on the power button does.
Setup what a short press on the power button does.

item.text: Position of finished Timers in Timerlist
item.description: Control of the position how finished timer are shown in the Timer List.
Set the time how long the infobar is shown.
Set the type of the progress indication in the channel selection screen

item.text: Show channel numbers in channel selection
item.description: Enables channel numbers in the channel selection screen
If set to 'yes' the infobar will be displayed when changing channels.
If set to 'yes' the infobar will be displayed when Fast Forwarding or Rewinding during media playback.
If set to 'yes' the infobar will be displayed when a new event starts.
Enable and set the duration of the second infobar (press OK twice) that may include more information on the current service. Also EPG could be shown.
Show background when tuned to a radio channel.
Hide any zap error messages.
Hide any Common Interface card error messages.
Show encryption info in the infobar (if the skin allows that).

item.text: Swap SNR in db with SNR in percentage on OSD
item.description: Swaps the indication of the SNR in dB or % (when the available tuner does support it).
Display the EIT now/next eventdata in infobar.
Choose what you want the button '0' to do when PIP is active.
Use the EIT EPG when tuned to a service.
Use the MHW EPG when tuned to a service.
Use the FreeSat EPG when tuned to a service.
Use the ViaSat EPG when tuned to a service.
Use the Netmed EPG when tuned to a service.
Enables EPG data of events in the past to be displayed. Handy when you want to know something about an event that is about to finish or has just finished (minutes).
Set the colour of the Teletext subtitles.
Use the original position of the Teletext subtitles.
Activate rewrapping of the teletext subtitles
Set the position of the Teletext subtitles.
Set the alignment of the Teletext subtitles.
Set the border width of the Teletext subtitles. This makes the titles more easy to read on a light background.
Set the font size of the Teletext subtitles.
Set the Teletext subtitle delay when timing lacks.
Use yellow DVB subtitles.
Set the position of the DVB subtitles.
Center the position of the DVB subtitles.
Set the transparency of the DVB subtitles.
Use Yellow pango DVB subtitles
Set the audio language 1 (highest priority)
Set the audio language 2
Set the audio language 3
Set the audio language 4 (lowest priority)
If set to 'yes' the receiver will use AC3 sound (when available).

item.text: Prefer audio stream stored by service
item.description: If set to 'yes' the receiver will use the audio stream that has been used earlier.
Set the subtitle language selection 1 (highest priority)
Set the subtitle language selection 2
Set the subtitle language selection 3
Set the subtitle language selection 4 (lowest priority)
Usually when the subtitle language is the same as the audio language subtitles are surpressed. This option allows showing subtitles when they are the same.
Enable hearing impaired subtitles
Prefer hearing impaired subtitles over normal subtitles.
Prefer the DVB-graphical subtitles over Teletext subtitles.
If set to 'yes' the receiver will use the subtitles that has been used earlier.
Set the EPG language selection 1
Set the EPG language selection 2
When a recording needs to be started it is allowed to interrupt the watched service
Add a margin before the start time of programmed timers referred to EPG
Add a margin after the end time of programmed timers referred to EPG
Show a popup when a recording starts

item.text: Load Length of Movies in Movielist
item.description: Show the lenght of a recording in the movielist (this might cause some additional loading time)
Configure the type of status indication icons shown in the movielist

item.text: Behavior when a movie is started
item.description: Configure the behaviour when a movie is started

item.text: Behavior when a movie is stopped
item.description: Configure the behaviour when a movie is manually stopped

item.text: Behavior when a movie reaches the end
item.description: Configure the behaviour when a movie reaches the end

item.text: Display message before next played movie
item.description: Show a popup when one movie has finished and the next one will start
Configure the behaviour of 'pause' when the movie is paused
Configure the time of the stepskip on the '1'/'3'-keys
Configure the time of the stepskip on the '4'/'6'-keys
Configure the time of the stepskip on the '7'/'9'-keys
Configure the possible fast forward speeds
Configure the possible rewind speeds
Configure the slow motion speeds
Set the initial fast forward speed
Set the initial rewind speed

item.text: Limited character set for recording filenames
item.description: Limit the characters that can be used in recording filenames - this allows the functionality on operating systems that do not allow all kinds of characters
Configure the way recording filenames are composed

item.text: Delete old timers after how many days
item.description: Configure the number of days old timers are kept and then auto deleted from the timers list
Enables the trashcan feature
Configure the number of days that items are automaticaly removed from the trashcan

item.text: Disk space to reserve for recordings (in GB)
item.description: Define the number of GB to be made free by removing files from the trashcan before a recording starts
Configure on which devices the background delete option should be used
Configure the speed of the background delete feature
Configure the offline decode delay in ms
Configure the Harddisk to go to standby after being idle for a specific time
Choose to enable or disable DHCP.
You can set the IP Address.
You can set the Netmask.
You can set the Gateway.
You can set the Nameserver.
Activate the chosen network settings.
Test mode
Set the brightness level for normal operation.
Set the contrast level.
Set the brightness level for standby.
Choose which tuner to configure.
Set the desired configuration mode.
Choose the correct DiSEqC mode for this LNB.
Set your Longitude:
Set your Latitude:
Use power measurement to detect when the rotor stops turning (if your receiver supports that).
